snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has proposed slashing money for libraries and after-school programs and increasing fees on school lunches and parking meters.
abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg proposes slashing money for libraries and after school programs, and increasing fees on school lunches and parking meters, to compensate for more than $600 million in lost revenue as plans to sell 2,000 new yellow-taxi medallions remain in doubt; proposal represents a contingency plan to cope with budget shortfall that must be addressed by end of fiscal year in June 2013.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has proposed slashing money for libraries and after-school programs and increasing fees on school lunches and parking meters.

headline.seo: Bloomberg Proposes Cuts to Libraries and Higher Fees on School Lunches
headline.main: As Shortfall Looms, Bloomberg Plans Cuts
headline.print_headline: As Shortfall Looms, Bloomberg Plans Cuts
